info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 4 at 7:39AM EDT until April 4 at 10:30AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh PA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring.
* WHERE...Portions of southwest Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Greene and Washington and the northern panhandle of West Virginia, including the following county, Brooke.
* WHEN...Until 1030 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding from 1 to 2 inches of rainfall overnight. It will take a few hours for all the water from the earlier rain to work through local drainage systems.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 736 AM EDT, emergency management reported ongoing road flooding in Greene County, with road closures along Route 18 in particular. Some minor flooding was also reported in Eighty Four in Washington County, and other small streams and roads in the warning area are also likely to experience flooding this morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... McMurray, Washington, Canonsburg, Waynesburg, Avella, Gastonville, California, Wolfdale, McGovern, Bentleyville, East Washington, Fredericktown-Millsboro, Jefferson Boro, Fairdale, Baidland, Houston, Ellsworth, Rogersville, West Finley and Claysville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM EDT THIS MORNING

area.areaDesc: Greene, PA; Washington, PA; Brooke, WV
